subject: Cooking
title: The Michelin Star System: Tire Company to Taste Arbiter
description: A 60-second lesson on The Michelin Star System: Tire Company to Taste Arbiter.

hook.text: The world's most prestigious restaurant rating was invented to sell tires. That's not a joke.

buildup.text: In 1900, Michelin Tires published a free driving guide with gas stations, hotels, and good restaurants.

discovery.text: The logic: if people drove farther for great food, they'd wear out tires faster and buy more Michelin products.

twist.text: By 1926, they added the star system. Three stars meant 'worth a special journey' â€” a meaning unchanged today.

climax.text: Losing a star has driven chefs to depression and even suicide â€” the pressure of Michelin's power is immense.

punchline.text: The most feared critics in food are anonymous inspectors from a tire company.

quiz.question: Why did the Michelin tire company create a restaurant guide?
options: To encourage driving (and tire purchases) to distant restaurants
